name: Guanfeng Liu 0001
content: Guanfeng Liu's Homepage A/Prof. Guanfeng Liu (PhD) Associate Professor (Professor in North America) Course Director of Data Science Deputy Director of Master of Research IEEE Senior Member School of Computing Macquarie University Sydney, Australia, 2109 Office: BD Building, Level 3 Email: guanfeng.liu [at] mq.edu.au Tel: +61-2-9850-9542 Fax: +61-2-9850-9551 Dr. Guanfeng Liu is an Associate Professor in School of Computing, Macquarie University, Sydney, Australia. His research interests include graph database, graph neural network, and graph data mining. He has published more than 100 papers on international journals and conferences including, IEEE Transactionson Knowledge and Data Engineering, IEEE Transactions on Services Computing, IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence, ACM Transactions on the Web, ACM Transactions on Data Science, SIGIR, ICDE, WWW, IJCAI, AAAI and CIKM, etc. Research Interests and Topics AI-Powered Medical Data Analytics Abstract: This research aims to develop an advanced AI-driven medical data analytics platform that leverages cutting-edge data science and analytics techniques to improve healthcare decision-making, patient outcomes, and operational efficiency. By integrating machine learning, graph data mining, and predictive modeling, the platform will enable efficient extraction, analysis, and visualization of complex medical data. Research Areas: Predictive Modeling, Graph Databases, Graph Data Mining, Machine Learning, Healthcare Data Analytics Trustworthy AI: Ensuring Reliability, Fairness, and Transparency Abstract: This research aims to develop robust methodologies for building trustworthy AI systems that prioritize reliability, fairness, transparency, and security. By integrating techniques such as explainable AI (XAI), bias mitigation, adversarial robustness, and ethical AI frameworks, the research will address critical challenges in ensuring AI models are interpretable, unbiased, and secure across various applications, including healthcare, finance, and cybersecurity. Research Areas: Explainable AI, Fairness in AI, Adversarial Robustness, Ethical AI, Secure Machine Learning, Trustworthy Data Analytics AI-Powered Database Systems Abstract: This research focuses on the development of next-generation AI-powered database systems designed to revolutionize data management, querying, and analysis processes across various domains. By leveraging advancements in AI, including machine learning, deep learning, and automated optimization, these systems will provide intelligent data indexing, adaptive query optimization, and real-time analytics. The goal is to create highly scalable, self-managing database platforms that can handle large-scale, heterogeneous, and dynamic datasets with exceptional efficiency and flexibility. Research Areas: Automated Query Optimization, Intelligent Data Indexing, Machine Learning for Databases, Deep Learning Applications, Distributed Database Systems, AI-Driven Data Security and Privacy Latest News 07/2025: I have been invited to serve as an Associate Chair for CIKM 2026 (CORE A) 07/2025: I have been invited to serve as an Area Chair for KDD 2026 (one of the flagship data mining conferences, CORE A*, CCF A) 05/2025: Our research paper "GPE: Global Position Embedding for Trajectory Similarity Computation" was accepted by one of the flagship data mining conferences KDD 2025 (CORE A*, CCF A). 04/2025: We have three papers accepted by the top conference IJCAI 2025 (CORE A*, CCF A). Adaptive Graph Unlearning GPL4SRec: Graph Multi-Level Aware Prompt Learning for Streaming Recommendation Towards Comprehensive and Prerequisite-Free Explainer for Graph Neural Networks 04/2025: Our research paper "Candidate-aware Graph Prompt-Tuning for Recommendation" was accepted by the top journal, Pattern Recognition (JCR Q1) 04/2025: Our research paper "PCDE: A Personalized Conversational Debiasing Framework for Next POI Recommendation with Uncertain Check-ins" was accepted by the top journal, Neural Networks (JCR Q1) 03/2025: Our research paper "Inter-Class and Intra-Class Re-Weighting for Topological-Imbalance Graph Neural Networks" was accepted by the top journal, IEEE Transactions on Emerging Topics in Computational Intelligence (TETCI) (JCR Q1) 03/2025: Our research paper "PerFedKG: Two-Stage Information-Loop Federated Knowledge graph for Personalized Privacy-Preserving Recommendation Systems" was accepted by the top journal, Science China Information Sciences (SCIS) (JCR Q1, CCF A) 03/2025: I have been invited to serve as an Senior PC for CIKM 2025 (CORE A, CCF B) 03/2025: We are organizing a special session on Private, Secure and Trust Data Analytics (PSTDA) at ADMA 2025 (CCF C), Kyoto, Japan, October 22–24, 2025. 03/2025: Our tutorial "AI and Data Mining in the Era of Trust and Security" has been accepted for presentation at PAKDD 2025, Sydney, Australia, June 10–13, 2025. 02/2025: Our research paper "Intent Propagation Contrastive Collaborative Filtering" was accepted by the top journal, IEEE TKDE (JCR Q1, CCF A) 02/2025: We are organizing a special issue, "AI-Driven Intrusion Detection and Threat Analysis in Cybersecurity", in Computers, Materials & Continua (CMC, SCI IF=2.1, Q2), Call for Paper is online (Due: 31/08/2025). 02/2025: We are organizing a special issue, "AI4Tech - AI Advancing Critical Technologies", in International Journal of Data Science and Analytics (JDSA, SCI IF=3.4, Q2), Call for Paper is online (Due: 31/12/2025). 01/2025: I have been invited to serve as an Editoral Board Member for Scientific Reports (JCR Q1) 01/2025: I have been invited to serve as an Area Chair for KDD 2025 (one of the flagship data mining conferences, CORE A*, CCF A) 01/2025: Our research paper "Few-Shot Causal Representation Learning for Out-of-Distribution Generalization on Heterogeneous Graphs" was accepted by the top journal, IEEE TKDE (JCR Q1, CCF A) 12/2024: Our research paper "Fuzzy Collaborative Reasoning" was accepted by the top AI conference AAAI 2025 (CORE A*, CCF A) 11/2024: I have invited to serve as an Senior PC for IJCAI 2025 (one of the best AI conferences, CORE A*, CCF A) MRes and PhD Scholarships I am seeking highly motivated and focused students with Backgrounds & Interests in Computer Science, Mathematics, and Engineering. Excellence in Higher Degree Research-Science and Engineering, Highly Commended, Macquarie University, 2011 (The video at YouTube) Excellent Organization and Service, The 10th Macquarie Computing Doctoral Conference (MCDC-11), Macquarie University, Sydney, Australia,June 8-9,2011.
